intro: Pisonia crenulata, commonly known as the Hawaiian pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found growing on rocky or sandy soils. Pisonia crenulata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and providing shelter for small wildlife.
